div.l: AT Trumppyngton̄ not fer fro Cambrigge
Ther rennyþ a brook ⁊and ouer þᵗat is a brygge
Vp on wheche broke þer stant a mille
For this is soth verraly þat y yow telle
A miller͗e was þer͗e dwellynge many a day
As ony pecok he was proud and gay
Pipen he couthe and fisshe ⁊and nettes bete
And torne cupes and wel wrastel and shete
Ay bi his belt he bare a long panade
And of a swerdawerd a swerd ful trnchaunt was þe blade
A Ioly popper bare he in his pouche
Ther was noman for ꝑperil durste him touche
A Sheffeld thwitel bare he in his hose
Round was his face and cammuse was his nose
And pilled as an ape was his skulle
He was a market dassher atte fulle
Ther dorste noman handes vp on him legge
That he ne swor he shuld anon̄ abegge
A thef he was forsoþe of corn̄ and mele
And that asly and vsaunt for to stele
His name was hote deynous symkyn
A wyff he hadde come of noble kyn
The ꝑperson of þe toun̄ her fadir was
With hir he ȝaf full many a panne of bras
For that symkyn shuld in his blod alie
She was fostred in an nonnerie
For symkyn wolde no wiff haue as he seide
But she were well norisshed and amayde
To saue his estate and yomanrie
And she was as proud as is a pie
A wel faire syȝt was it vp on hem two
On holy dayes beforn̄ hir wold he goo
With his typpet wounden a bout his hed
And she come aftir in a gite of red
And symkyn had hosen of þe same
There durste noman clepe hir but dame
Was non̄ so hardy man that goth bi þe wey
That with hir dorste on̄s rage or pley
